title: Authors and Citation
text: Layton R, Long R, Ohland M, Orr M, Lord S (2022). midfielddata: MIDFIELD Data Sample. R package version 0.2.0, https://midfieldr.github.io/midfielddata/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {midfielddata: MIDFIELD Data Sample},   author = {Richard Layton and Russell Long and Matthew Ohland and Marisa Orr and Susan Lord},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.2.0},   url = {https://midfieldr.github.io/midfielddata/}, }

title: MIDFIELD Data Sample
text: Data “student-level” refers information collected undergraduate institutions individual students, including: course information, e.g., course name & number, credit hours, student grades term information, e.g., program, academic standing, grade point average student demographic information, e.g., age, sex, race/ethnicity degree information, e.g., institution, program, term, baccalaureate degree midfielddata provides anonymized student-level records 98,000 undergraduates three US institutions 1988 2018, collected four data tables keyed student ID. Table 1. Practice data midfielddata. data proportionate stratified sample MIDFIELD database, suitable drawing inferences program attributes student experiences—midfielddata provides practice data, research data.

title: MIDFIELD Data Sample
text: Data tables can loaded individually groups needed. illustrate data structure, examine student-level data one specific student.
code: # Load multiple tables at once data(student, course, term, degree, package = "midfielddata") # One student ID mcid_we_want <- "MCID3112192438"

title: MIDFIELD Data Sample
text: student data table contains one observation per student. select subset columns less cluttered printout.
code: # Select specific rows and columns rows_we_want <- student$mcid == mcid_we_want cols_we_want <- c("mcid", "institution", "transfer", "race", "sex", "age_desc")  # All observations for this ID df <- student[rows_we_want, cols_we_want]  # Cleanup and display row.names(df) <- NULL df #>             mcid   institution              transfer  race    sex age_desc #> 1 MCID3112192438 Institution C First-Time in College White Female Under 25

title: MIDFIELD Data Sample
text: Course data structured block-record form, , records associated particular ID can span multiple rows—one record per student per course per term. example case, course records span 47 rows.
code: # Select specific rows and columns rows_we_want <- course$mcid == mcid_we_want cols_we_want <- c("mcid", "term_course", "course", "grade")  # All observations for this ID df <- course[rows_we_want, cols_we_want]  # Cleanup and display row.names(df) <- NULL df #>              mcid term_course                         course grade #> 1  MCID3112192438       20051 Key Academic title: MIDFIELD Data Sample
text: Term data also structured block-record form—one record per student per term. example case, term records span 10 rows.
code: # Select specific rows and columns rows_we_want <- term$mcid == mcid_we_want cols_we_want <- c("mcid", "term", "cip6", "level", "standing", "gpa_cumul")  # All observations for this ID df <- term[rows_we_want, cols_we_want]  # Cleanup and display row.names(df) <- NULL df #>              mcid  term   cip6              level      standing gpa_cumul #> 1  MCID3112192438 20051 451101      01 First-year Good Standing      3.80 #> 2  MCID3112192438 20053 190701      01 First-year Good Standing      3.63 #> 3  MCID3112192438 20061 451101     02 Second-year Good Standing      3.49 #> 4  MCID3112192438 20063 451101     02 Second-year Good Standing      3.54 #> 5  MCID3112192438 20071 451101      03 Third-year Good Standing      3.58 #> 6  MCID3112192438 20073 451101      03 Third-year Good Standing      3.54 #> 7  MCID3112192438 20081 451101      03 Third-year Good Standing      3.58 #> 8  MCID3112192438 20083 451101     04 Fourth-year Good Standing      3.61 #> 9  MCID3112192438 20091 451101     04 Fourth-year Good Standing      3.65 #> 10 MCID3112192438 20093 451101 05 Fifth-year Plus Good Standing      3.68

title: MIDFIELD Data Sample
text: Degree data also structured block-record form—one record per student per degree. Multiple degrees can occur term different terms. example case, degree records indicate double degree Psychology Sociology earned term. students one degree earn term. example, next student earned degree Biological Sciences 1996 second baccalaureate degree Animal Biology 1999. analyses, first baccalaureate degree used.
code: # Select specific rows and columns rows_we_want <- degree$mcid == mcid_we_want cols_we_want <- c("mcid", "term_degree", "cip6", "degree")  # All observations for this ID df <- degree[rows_we_want, cols_we_want]  # Cleanup and display row.names(df) <- NULL df #>             mcid term_degree   cip6                            degree #> 1 MCID3112192438       20093 420101 Bachelor of Science in Psychology #> 2 MCID3112192438       20093 451101     Bachelor of Arts in Sociology # Select specific rows and columns rows_we_want <- degree$mcid == "MCID3111315508" cols_we_want <- c("mcid", "term_degree", "cip6", "degree")  # All observations for this ID df <- degree[rows_we_want, cols_we_want]  # Cleanup and display row.names(df) <- NULL df #>             mcid term_degree   cip6                                     degree #> 1 MCID3111315508       19961 260101 Bachelor of Science in Biological Sciences #> 2 MCID3111315508       19994 260701      Bachelor of Science in Animal Biology

title: MIDFIELD Data Sample
text: Install : installed size midfielddata 24 Mb, two consequences. First, installation takes time. Second, host package MIDFIELD ‘drat’ repository instead CRAN 24 Mb exceeds CRAN package limit (5 Mb).

title: MIDFIELD Data Sample
text: midfieldr companion R package provides tools detailed procedures working MIDFIELD data. MIDFIELD MIDFIELD database contains, October 2022, individual student-level data 1.7M undergraduates 19 US institutions 1987 2018. Access MIDFIELD research database currently limited MIDFIELD partner institutions. sample data supplied midfielddata.

title: Student-level course data — course
text: Student-level course information approximately 98,000 undergraduates, keyed student ID. Data "student-level" refers information collected undergraduate institutions individual students, example, course name number, credit hours, student grades.

title: Student-level course data — course
text: data.frame data.table 12 variables approximately 3.3M observations 97,555 unique students occupying 325 MB memory: mcid Character, anonymized student identifier, e.g., MCID3111142225. institution Character, anonymized institution name, e.g., Institution B. term_course Character, academic year term, format YYYYT. course Character, course name, e.g., Astrophysics III, Calculus Social Science Business, Corp Financial Rprtng 1, Environmental Sanitation II, Fitness Wellness, Introductory Astronomy 2, Changing Environment, etc. abbrev Character, course alpha identifier, e.g. AA, MATH, ACCT, EH, HES, ASTR, etc. number Character, course numeric identifier, e.g. 1104, 1209, 228, 4047, etc. section Character, course section identifier, one four characters, e.g., 1, 2, 01, 14, 001, 040, 785, H02, R01, 300E, 888R, etc. type Character, predominant delivery method section, e.g., Blended, Distance Education, Face--Face, Online, etc. faculty_rank Character, academic rank person teaching course, e.g., Assistant Professor, Associate Professor, Graduate Assistant, Visiting Faculty, etc. hours_course Numeric, number credit-hours successful course completion. grade Character, course grade, e.g., +, , -, B+, , NG, etc. discipline_midfield Character, variable grouping courses academic discipline assigned MIDFIELD data curator, e.g., Anthropology, Business, Computer Science, Engineering, Language Literature, Mathematics, Visual Performing Arts, etc.

title: Student-level course data — course
text: 2022 MIDFIELD database

title: Student-level course data — course
text: Course data structured block-record form, , records associated particular ID can span multiple rows---one record per student per course per term. Terms encoded YYYYT, YYYY year start academic year T encodes semester quarter within academic year Fall (1), Winter (2), Spring (3), Summer (4, 5, 6). example, academic year 1995--96, Fall 95--96 encoded 19951, Spring 95--96 encoded 19953, first Summer 95-96 term encoded 19954. source database includes special month-long sessions encoded letters , B, C, etc., though none included sample. data midfielddata proportionate stratified sample MIDFIELD database, suitable drawing inferences program attributes student experiences---midfielddata provides practice data, research data.

title: Student-level course data — course
code: if (FALSE) {  # Load data data(course)  # Select specific rows and columns rows_we_want <- course$mcid == MCID3112192438 cols_we_want <- c(mcid, term_course, course, grade)  # View observations for this ID  course[rows_we_want, cols_we_want]  }

title: Student-level degree data — degree
text: Student-level degree information approximately 50,000 undergraduates earning degrees, keyed student ID. Data "student-level" refers information collected undergraduate institutions individual students, example, institution, program, term, baccalaureate degree.

title: Student-level degree data — degree
text: data.frame data.table 5 variables 49,543 observations unique students occupying 6 MB memory: mcid Character, anonymized student identifier, e.g., MCID3111142225. institution Character, anonymized institution name, e.g., Institution B. term_degree Character, academic year term, format YYYYT, student completes program. cip6 Character, 6-digit CIP code program student earns degree, e.g., 090101, 141201, 260901, 420101, etc. degree Character, type degree awarded, e.g., Bachelor Arts Geography, Bachelor Science Finance, etc.

title: Student-level degree data — degree
text: 2022 MIDFIELD database

title: Student-level degree data — degree
text: Degree data structured block-record form, , records associated particular ID can span multiple rows---one record per student per degree. Multiple degrees can occur term different terms. Terms encoded YYYYT, YYYY year start academic year T encodes semester quarter within academic year Fall (1), Winter (2), Spring (3), Summer (4, 5, 6). example, academic year 1995--96, Fall 95--96 encoded 19951, Spring 95--96 encoded 19953, first Summer 95-96 term encoded 19954. source database includes special month-long sessions encoded letters , B, C, etc., though none included sample. program codes, midfielddata uses 2010 version Classification Instructional Programs (CIP). midfieldr package installed loaded, type ?cip details. data midfielddata proportionate stratified sample MIDFIELD database, suitable drawing inferences program attributes student experiences---midfielddata provides practice data, research data.

title: Student-level degree data — degree
code: if (FALSE) {  # Load data data(degree)  # Select specific rows and columns rows_we_want <- degree$mcid == MCID3112192438 cols_we_want <- c(mcid, term_degree, cip6, degree)  # View observations for this ID  degree[rows_we_want, cols_we_want]  }

title: MIDFIELD Data Sample — midfielddata-package
text: data package contains anonymized student-level records 98,000 undergraduates three US institutions 1988 2018 organized four data tables keyed student ID. Data "student-level" refers information collected undergraduate institutions individual students including demographics, programs, academic standing, courses, grades, degrees. data proportionate stratified sample MIDFIELD database, suitable drawing inferences program attributes student experiences---midfielddata provides practice data, research data.

title: MIDFIELD Data Sample — midfielddata-package
text: 2022 MIDFIELD database

title: Student-level demographic data — student
text: Student-level demographic information approximately 98,000 degree-seeking undergraduate students, keyed student ID. Data "student-level" refers information collected undergraduate institutions individual students, example, age, sex, race/ethnicity matriculation.

title: Student-level demographic data — student
text: data.frame data.table 13 variables 97,555 observations unique students occupying 18 MB memory: mcid Character, anonymized student identifier, e.g., MCID3111142225. institution Character, anonymized institution name, e.g., Institution B. transfer Character, transfer status, possible values First-Time College, First-Time Transfer. hours_transfer Numeric, number credit hours transferred (NA). race Character, race/ethnicity, e.g., Asian, Black, International, Latine, etc. sex Character, sex, possible values Female, Male, Unknown. age_desc Character, age group, possible values 25 Older, 25. us_citizen Character, US citizenship, possible values , Yes. home_zip Character, home ZIP code (NA), e.g., 02056, 20170, 51301, 80129, etc. high_school Character, code last high school attended admission (NA), e.g., 060075, 210512, 431800, 502195, etc. sat_math Numeric, SAT mathematics test score (NA). sat_verbal Numeric, SAT reading test score (NA). act_comp Numeric, ACT composite test score (NA).

title: Student-level demographic data — student
text: 2022 MIDFIELD database

title: Student-level demographic data — student
text: Student data structured row-record form, , information associated particular ID occupies single row---one record per student. data midfielddata proportionate stratified sample MIDFIELD database, suitable drawing inferences program attributes student experiences---midfielddata provides practice data, research data.

title: Student-level demographic data — student
code: if (FALSE) {  # Load data data(student)  # Select specific rows and columns rows_we_want <- student$mcid == MCID3112192438 cols_we_want <- c(mcid, institution, transfer, race, sex, age_desc)  # View observations for this ID  student[rows_we_want, cols_we_want]  }

title: Student-level term data — term
text: Student-level term information approximately 98,000 undergraduates, keyed student ID. Data "student-level" refers information collected undergraduate institutions individual students, example, program code, academic standing, grade point average term.

title: Student-level term data — term
text: data.frame data.table 13 variables approximately 640,000 observations 97,555 unique students occupying 73 MB memory: mcid Character, anonymized student identifier, e.g., MCID3111142225. institution Character, anonymized institution name, e.g., Institution B. term Character, academic year term, format YYYYT. cip6 Character, 6-digit CIP code program student enrolled term, e.g., 090101, 141201, 260901, 420101, etc. level Character, academic level determined cumulative number credit earned, e.g., 01 First-year, 02 Second-year, etc. standing Character, academic standing, e.g., Good Standing, Academic Warning, etc. coop Character, cooperative education term, possible values Yes, . hours_term Numeric, credit hours earned term. hours_term_attempt Numeric, credit hours attempted term. hours_cumul Numeric, cumulative credit hours earned. hours_cumul_attempt Numeric, cumulative credit hours attempted. gpa_term Numeric, term grade point average. gpa_cumul Numeric, cumulative grade point average.

title: Student-level term data — term
text: 2022 MIDFIELD database

title: Student-level term data — term
text: Term data structured block-record form, , records associated particular ID can span multiple rows---one record per student per term. Terms encoded YYYYT, YYYY year start academic year T encodes semester quarter within academic year Fall (1), Winter (2), Spring (3), Summer (4, 5, 6). example, academic year 1995--96, Fall 95--96 encoded 19951, Spring 95--96 encoded 19953, first Summer 95-96 term encoded 19954. source database includes special month-long sessions encoded letters , B, C, etc., though none included sample. program codes, midfielddata uses 2010 version Classification Instructional Programs (CIP). midfieldr package installed loaded, type ?cip details. data midfielddata proportionate stratified sample MIDFIELD database, suitable drawing inferences program attributes student experiences---midfielddata provides practice data, research data.

title: Student-level term data — term
code: if (FALSE) {  # Load data data(term)  # Select specific rows and columns rows_we_want <- term$mcid == "MCID3112192438" cols_we_want <- c("mcid", "term", "cip6", "level", "standing", "gpa_cumul")  # View observations for this ID  term[rows_we_want, cols_we_want]   }

title: midfielddata 0.2.0 (2022-12)
text: New sample data, four data sets Update package tests match Update README documentation

title: midfielddata 0.1.5 (2022-10)
text: Revise race/ethnicity change Latinx Latine Ensure values “” replaced NA_character_

title: midfielddata 0.1.4 (2022-07)
text: Match variable names practice data MIDFIELD research data Edit MIDFIELD project URL

title: midfielddata 0.1.3 (2021-07)
text: Removed problematic data 2003 Institution M Added data tests check range possible values Minor edits .Rd help pages

title: midfielddata 0.1.2 (2021-06)
text: changed names data tables student, term, course, degree consistent research data updates variables names consistent research data update authors contributors DESCRIPTION set LazyData FALSE update Rd help pages edit license remove Travis CI Update README

title: midfielddata 0.1.1 (2020-07)
text: reformatted data frames data.tables remove dependencies dplyr related packages edited help pages

title: midfielddata 0.1.0 (2018-06)
text: made public GitHub
